definition: to bend/bent/a bend/a turn (in the road etc)/CL:道[dao4]
to break (e.g. stick or bone)/a loss
to turn sth over/to turn upside down/to tip sth out (of a container)

to break/to fracture/to snap/to suffer loss/to bend/to twist/to turn/to change direction/convinced/to convert into (currency)/discount/rebate/tenth (in price)/classifier for theatrical scenes/to fold/accounts book

sentences.english: and no familiar voice being bent in the wind.
sentences.chinese: 也没有熟悉的声音在风中弯折。

sentences.english: Minimum of three inner wraps to prevent buckling.
sentences.chinese: 为了防止弯折，最少有三层内套。

sentences.english: After mounting, do not process the capacitors or bend the terminals.
sentences.chinese: 安装后，请匆加工电容器或弯折端子等。

sentences.english: Soft, especially bend and mobile, resistance, steady not twist.
sentences.chinese: 特别柔软，尤耐弯折，往返移动，平稳不扭。

sentences.english: The four legs are made of solid alloy aluminum with a high polished finish.
sentences.chinese: 椅脚的部分是实心的铝条弯折而成。

sentences.english: The periodic buckling leaves the fibre in a waved conformation.
sentences.chinese: 周期性的弯折在纤维中造成了波形结构。

sentences.english: Another common malady that shows up in images are broken wrists.
sentences.chinese: 另外一种照片中经常出现的问题是手腕被弯折。

sentences.english: The level of bow or bend depends on the motherboard material properties and component layout.
sentences.chinese: 拱起和弯折的幅度取决于主板材质和组件的布局。

definition: to bend/to curve around/curved/crooked/to wind/to warp
vertical/to erect/to set upright/vertical stroke in Chinese characters/young servant (old)
deformation/to become deformed/to change shape/to morph
